page.title: 07FARMING
page.content:
This is a rural, highly mechanised, intensive agricultural area. Cereal and root crops predominate but a large proportion of the land is pasture for dairy and beef cattle and sheep. There are also some intensive calf and poultry rearing units. The cereals are wheat and barley and the main root crop being potatoes together with small acreages of peas and turnips.
Most of the farms exceed 200 acres and are almost self-sufficient in that very little feedstuffs have to be bought in for the livestock and virtually no contract hiring of extra machinery is necessary. The only additional labour that is now required are gangs of potato pickers in late September / early October.
